Articles.Content:
To boldly go where no man has gone before... well, now Kerbals have been there, in this one-man Starship Enterprise! You can almost hear the space lasers and plasma cannons. Maybe one day those'll be stock. Pew pew pew pew pew

Thanks for viewing, and leave some rep if you enjoyed!
Fairings for the saucer section? Yeah, it's a good idea.

I've been trying to do this for the past few days, how on earth did you get the saucer fairing to extend to such a large radius?

A very fine job Zucal! As I can't send you gold pressed latinum, ill send some rep instead

Edit: (after I spread some around, dammit)

2nd Edit: Aha, size 3.75 Fairing FTW!

Edited May 4, 2015 by whoshotdk
This has to be one of the best looking Enterprises I've seen in a long time. Especially considering it's small size.

Not bad.

But ships like this make us ask the question: is it actually possible to remove something from staging permanently (as in make it so you cant even accidentally stage hull parts). Thatd be nice, as well as the option to add stuff to staging that was never intended to be in staging.

That's a good point panzer1b.

My recent Semyorka also uses fairings for decorative purposes and what I do is stick the not-for-staging-fairings into the last stage and then use the lock-stage feature (ALT-L) once I've staged everything else. Stage.
